As far as I know, an assassin is a squishy champion with high mobility, able to jump onto a target and kill it fast and then having an **escape** to leave the fight without getting killed himself.

A diver is a more durable champion with great engage and some defensive tricks to survive in the middle of the fight long enough for their team to follow up. A diver usually doesn't have an reliable escape to leave a fight.

If these definitions are correct to some degree, in my opinion Nocturne clearly has the playstyle of a diver. He is more durable than the average assassin, but has no escape to get out of a fight.
